com.mygdx.game.projectile

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion
      • com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
        • com.mygdx.game.projectile.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite
    Represents a Projectile in the game. Always moves in a straight line based on a given slope.
    Version:
    May 31, 2015
    Author:
    Andrew Si wrote the move() method, Christopher Cheung wrote the constructor, Nathan Lui wrote the hitCharacter() method, Period: 4, Assignment: my-gdx-game-core, Sources: libgdx

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projectile(Character c, int damage, java.lang.String type, float distanceX, float distanceY)
      Constructs a Projectile class DistanceX and distanceY determines the slope of the line that this projectile should be moving on.
      Projectile(float x, float y, float w, float h, int d)
      Constructs this Projectile without animations, For testing only Projectile will be unable to move.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDamage()
      Returns the damage that this projectile deals
      boolean hitCharacter(Character c)
      Returns whether this projectile hits a given character based on bounding rectangles if Character is the same as the one that spawned this projectile, this method should return false
      void move()
      Moves this projectile on the line with slope based on the given xDistance and yDistance from constructor Updates animation based on time Cannot be JUnit tested due to animations

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(Character c,
          int damage,
          java.lang.String type,
          float distanceX,
          float distanceY)
        Constructs a Projectile class DistanceX and distanceY determines the slope of the line that this projectile should be moving on. This projectile will continue to move on that line until removed from game.
        Parameters:
        c - Character that this Projectile originates from.
        damage - The damage that this Projectile will deal
        type - the type of projectile, used for file input to get animation pictures
        distanceX - the x distance used to determine slope
        distanceY - the y distance used to determine slope

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(float x,
          float y,
          float w,
          float h,
          int d)
        Constructs this Projectile without animations, For testing only Projectile will be unable to move.
        Parameters:
        x - -coordinate as starting point
        y - -coordinate as starting point
        w - width of the projectile
        h - height of the projectile
        d - damage that this projectile deals

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves this projectile on the line with slope based on the given xDistance and yDistance from constructor Updates animation based on time Cannot be JUnit tested due to animations

      • hitCharacter

        public boolean hitCharacter(Character c)
        Returns whether this projectile hits a given character based on bounding rectangles if Character is the same as the one that spawned this projectile, this method should return false
        Parameters:
        c - Character to check with
        Returns:
        whether this projectile collides with Character

      • getDamage

        public int getDamage()
        Returns the damage that this projectile deals
        Returns:
        the damage that this projectile deals
